metadata.title: Interesting AI/ML Articles You Should Read This Week (Sep 5) | by Richmond Alake | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: Interesting AI/ML Articles You Should Read This Week (Sep 5)
metadata.description: In many areas around the globe the academic year starts, this means that amongst other courses and topics, 2020 will probably see an increase in the number of students interested in AI-related…

all_paragraphs: In many areas around the globe the academic year starts, this means that amongst other courses and topics, 2020 will probably see an increase in the number of students interested in AI-related courses, including Data Science.
This week’s article is dedicated to those that are starting their journey within the Data Science field and are seeking either academic or professional advice.
Medium has been and will always be a recommended source of learning and obtaining information.
There are experienced and talented Data Scientists who share a wealth of knowledge on Medium; this is one of the key reasons I would refer individuals interested in Data Science to the platform.
“A Data Science movement and you are invited”
Ken Jee is a prominent YouTuber within the Data Science community and has started a movement that focuses on developing and maintaining momentum within Data Science practitioners.

During your academic or professional journey in Data Science, you might some times run into a period of stagnation in knowledge accumulation or lack of inspiration. This feeling of been stagnant in learning and progression has led Ken to revisit the foundational topics of Data Science.
By embracing the concepts of accountability and consistency, Ken has started an internet movement dubbed #66DaysOfData.

According to Ken, #66DaysOfData is a habit-forming and inspiration generating movement that involves participants learning Data Science related topics for at least five minutes a day. Participants are encouraged to share their learnings on platforms such as LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.
For Data Science practitioners, this is an opportunity to join the data science community in a collective effort to spark inspiration and drive motivation within the community and individuals.
“A recollection of a Data Scientist first month and advice for maintaining a successful career”
Although Leon Lok is only a month into his Data Science role, he has managed to pick up some learnings and habits that will ensure that he has a fruitful and successful data science career.

In this article, Leon has shared some tips and advice that he believes will help those who are aiming to break into the data science field. Leon helps data science practitioners understand what it takes to be successful and survive.

Leon’s includes typical tips such as networking, notetaking, brainstorming, adaptability etc. Leon expands in detail how each tip and advice can be beneficial to individuals within data science roles.

Not only does Leon advises Data Scientists on how to navigate the early months of your career, but he also touches on topics that long term practitioners face, such as work pressure, imposter syndrome and idea generation.
“Seven reasons why you should start a technical blog”
Although Antoine Soetewey has only been writing for less than a year on his blog: statsandr.com, he has experienced notable benefits of maintaining the habit of writing and sharing code online.

By expanding on the key benefits of sharing code, Antoine hopes to incentivize machine learning practitioners to start their blogs, either through WordPress, Medium for non-technical blogs or Hugo(static site generator) for technical blogs.

Some of the benefits of consistent blogging and code sharing include the ability to learn through writing and explaining concepts and ideas to others. Another benefit is the possibility of creating new professional relationships and a platform to self promote.
At the end of the article, Antoine includes some tips on starting a blog, which I would recommend most machine learning practitioners to take on board and act on.
The whole article is an excellent read as it showcases the short-term benefits that can come from online technical writing.
“An exploration of startup possibilities that emerge from data science skills”
Many tech startups and companies today have roots in AI-based technology. In the past 20 years, AI has revolutionised industries and created a substantial amount of high net worth individuals.
There have been hundreds, if not thousands of startups that have emerged from the ‘hype’ of AI and machine learning.
Bharath K identifies startup ideas and possibilities within fields of AI such as Natural Language Processing(NLP), Machine Learning, Computer Vision etc.

Each field is accompanied by a description of the ideas and approaches that can be explored in order to develop a business. Ideas such as self-driving cars, AI-chatbots, recommendation systems, facial recognition are included in this article.
This short article provides a glimpse into a world of possibility that emerges from the skills that Data Science provides.
To connect with me or find more content similar to this article, do the following:
Your home for data science. A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas and codes.
Machine Learning Content Creator with 1M+ views— Computer Vision Engineer. Interested in gaining and sharing knowledge on Technology and Finance
